definitions.definition: To reverse direction and retrace one's steps.
definitions.example: Realising he had forgotten his briefcase, he turned back and re-entered the office.

definitions.definition: To cause to reverse direction and retrace one's steps.
definitions.example: The barrage of machine-gun fire turned back the encroaching soldiers.

definitions.definition: To return to a previous state of being.
definitions.example: He stopped drinking for a couple of years, but now he has turned back to his old ways.

definitions.definition: To prevent or refuse to allow passage or progress.
definitions.example: The soldiers turned back all the refugees at the frontier.

definitions.definition: To adjust to a previous setting.
definitions.example: I love that song: turn back to it!

definitions.definition: To fold something back; to fold down.
definitions.example: When you make the bed, please always turn the sheet back over the blanket.
